control

Interface IAdministerControl

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IErrorControl, IPhotoControl
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdminControl

    public interface IAdministerControl
extends IErrorControl, IPhotoControl
    Author:
    Conrado Uraga

    The class that implements this is created first when the program runs. Holds the control for "administering" the user that is run in the command line. Implemented methods are read command line args and to create, delete, or list users on the admin mode. Creates an interactive controller when the user logs in.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method provides a hook to enter the program. This should be implemented such that triggering of the program can occur without having to recreate the control object.
        Parameters:
        args - Normally command-line arguments

      • setAdminModel

        void setAdminModel(IPhotoAdminModel model)
        Parameters:
        model - Admin specific set of methods for interacting with the model.

      • listUsers

        void listUsers()
        List the existing users in the current database

      • addUser

        void addUser(java.lang.String id,
           java.lang.String name)
        Adds new user into the list
        Parameters:
        id - identifies the newly created user
        name - is the new user full name if user the name already exists, pass an error to IErrorControl.java

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser(java.lang.String id)
        delete the user off the list by passing an id
        Parameters:
        id - is found, we remove the user from the list. If not, we pass the error to IErrorControl.java

      • login

        void login(java.lang.String id)
        Login allows an existing user to login into the photo album
        Parameters:
        id - passed the unique user id to gain access. If user id doesn't exist, we shall pass an error to IErrorControl.java Once logged in, it goes into interactive mode.
